meta.title: Regional and Cross-Jurisdictional Public Authorities
meta.description: Public authorities that operate across NYC, NYS, or multi-state regions, organized by their legal foundations.

nodes.label: Regional Public Authority Laws
nodes.factoid: Legal frameworks establishing public authorities across city, state, and interstate jurisdictions.

nodes.label: Public Authorities Law
nodes.factoid: NY State law (Chapter 43-A) establishing and regulating state public benefit corporations.

nodes.label: NY Public Housing Law
nodes.factoid: State law enabling cities to create local housing authorities.

nodes.label: Port Authority Interstate Compact (1921)
nodes.factoid: Interstate compact between NY and NJ, ratified by Congress, creating the Port Authority.

nodes.label: Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA)
nodes.factoid: State authority managing NYC subway, buses, and regional commuter rail systems.

nodes.label: New York State Thruway Authority
nodes.factoid: State authority operating the Thruway highway system across New York.

nodes.label: New York Power Authority (NYPA)
nodes.factoid: State authority providing electric power generation and transmission.

nodes.label: Dormitory Authority (DASNY)
nodes.factoid: State authority financing construction of schools, hospitals, and public facilities.

nodes.label: Empire State Development (ESD)
nodes.factoid: State authority for economic development and business incentives.

nodes.label: Battery Park City Authority (BPCA)
nodes.factoid: State authority managing Battery Park City neighborhood in Manhattan.

nodes.label: Roosevelt Island Operating Corporation (RIOC)
nodes.factoid: State authority overseeing Roosevelt Island operations.

nodes.label: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
nodes.factoid: Bi-state agency managing bridges, tunnels, airports, and seaports in the NY-NJ region.

nodes.label: New York City Housing Authority (NYCHA)
nodes.factoid: City public authority providing affordable housing for NYC residents.
